episodes.title: '28 Years Later: The Bone Temple' Director Nia DaCosta on Humanity, Cults, and the Real Horror
episodes.description:
In this exclusive MovieWeb interview, director Nia DaCosta breaks down the themes driving '28 Years Later: The Bone Temple' — from grief, love, and “memento mori,” to cult psychology, belief systems, and the unsettling idea that humans may be more dangerous than the infected.

DaCosta discusses Kelson’s Bone Temple as a monument to love and memory, the emotional and moral weight of his relationship with Samson, and why Jimmy Crystal represents a different kind of horror — one rooted in trauma, charisma, and corrupted meaning. She also dives into why cults are so terrifying, how people lose individuality to feel safe, and what hope looks like in a world defined by rage.

This conversation explores how The Bone Temple expands the franchise in a darker, more intimate, and deeply human direction — while still leaving audiences unsettled long after the credits roll.
